tweets.text:
Severe #flood warnings have been issued in parts of Greater #Manchester as #StormChristoph brings more rain.
 
Find out more: https://t.co/pSJIL5Vlfz

Now a lot of snow falling in  Manchester. It's going to be a tough night for those impacted by flooding and working to help. Thoughts with all those affected. #StormChristoph
@EnvAgency https://t.co/AsxnZWcAqE

A dairy farmer, stuck up to their axles in mud whilst out spreading slurry during #StormChristoph on bare #maize stubble adjacent to a ditch.

There's been a big increase in illegal farm activities since the Covid started. Penalties should follow suit. https://t.co/TzA4AuUA0G
@HayleyH51368106 @ManCityCouncil @gmpolice @EnvAgency You can see the area here https://t.co/Q1D17PbAYH

Extreme weather means flooding throughout Warrington North, with peak floods expected in the early hours of the morning. I'm liaising with the local authority and the emergency services about affected areas.

Please stay indoors where you can and follow @EnvAgencyNW for updates. https://t.co/P3M8WX3tsQ

A Severe Flood Warning means we must act now & evacuations have started, focusing on those most vulnerable first.

1/7 https://t.co/x23iGk7ydC

Issuing severe #flood warnings is always hard as we know what it means for many people. Sadly @EnvAgencyNW have had to issue 1 for #Maghull #Merseyside This means there is risk to life / serious disruption. Pls follow advice. #BeSafe #StormCristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/SfbR2HUxQH
@NinjaHippo @tmbc_highways @EnvAgencyNW Noted

tweets.text: We are experiencing issues with the forecast model data displayed on our https://t.co/u5YnaL7y4i page along the #RiverSevern in #Shropshire. The correct forecast levels for #WelshBridge in #Shrewsbury are 4.1m to 4.5m which is more in line with normal winter flooding levels.

üö®Incident Updateüö®

The @EnvAgencyYNE are nearing the trigger to use #RotherRegulators which protect property through @RMBCPress & @MyDoncaster.

River levels on the Rother have meant that #TeamEA & RMBC have deployed #HVP‚Äôs to #Catcliffe which pump water away from homes. https://t.co/4EFeaHHucS

The @EnvAgency has reinforced earlier #FloodWarning on River Wye at #LittonMill.

#Flooding of property is possible from now. 

We have teams out. Emergency contact info üëâ https://t.co/SHUb8P1Yqc https://t.co/qmt89fzxph
@ttittifilarious @RogersSian @MrsRF @EnvAgency I wish!! Its still raining here....

Significant snow fall now adding to problems in #Warrington.  To report flooding the @EnvAgency has a 24 hour incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. Aware of further flood warnings in #Lymm and an liaising with @WarringtonBC #StormChristoph https://t.co/gGbsaB4su1
Update from #Worksop in #Notts. Please keep checking your #flood risk. Latest info here https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/lfr745GBVy

tweets.text:
Our #FieldTeam from @EnvAgencyYNE have today installed some temporary barrier along the #RiverDon in #Doncaster.

This barrier protects an access route to one of the #Covid19 vaccination centres.

It‚Äôs a precautionary measure in case the forecast worsens. https://t.co/IHErO1V8Y8

We have issued a severe #flood warning for #EastDidsbury #WestDidsbury and #Northenden which means a threat to life and significant disruption. 
We are working with the emergency services to keep communities to keep people safe. Updates ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/Ue0KEP0snL
@RogersSian @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE @Tod_Flood_Group Plague of locusts tomorrow üòÇ

One of the best projects I secured funding for back in @EnvAgency days was the establishment of the 
@savebutterflies National #Moth Recording Database in 2006. Now >25M records and a wealth of data showing trends due to climate and habitat changes etc. See Dec @britwildlife https://t.co/v2iqfwEjUs
@mrsk3r @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE @Tod_Flood_Group Eek apparently it‚Äôs snowing now! Here comes the sting in the tail - hope all ok your end x
Heart stopping moment when the gauge predictions shot up earlier, small glitch maybe? All looks well again now üòÖ@Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE @Tod_Flood_Group https://t.co/t1Qkog2mWF

Some intense rainfall over West Mids this evening on our radars (pink on the picture).  Worst of the rain will clear about midnight, don't be surprised if you see a bit of snow either..but do stay up to date with Flood Warnings from @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/nz681AdVjq https://t.co/pOr3wLooRG

Our engineers have been out to Palentine Road in #Didsbury earlier today to add sandbags around our substation to protect the network from any potential flooding. We're continuing to keep a close eye on things alongside @EnvAgencyNW üëâhttps://t.co/XfuX7fDCfG https://t.co/eZ0gctVHbh

tweets.text: We‚Äôre currently supporting our colleagues from @Go_CheshireWest, @CheshireFire and¬†@EnvAgencyNW, evacuating a number of residents from Hayhurst Marina due to the flooding cause by #StormChristoph. #StaySafe https://t.co/VqH0A1WD5h

#StormChristoph has led to high river levels across the country. Stay safe at home ‚Äì if you do need to head out, don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks. Check your flood risk before you leave: https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/NoJbBteLiZ

tweets.text: We have been bolstering the repairs we are currently making to Temple Manor wash lands in the Lower Aire today, as they fill up due to snowmelt and rainfall. Stay #floodaware and check the flood warnings where you live https://t.co/3UGLsuUejh

@Britt_W @EnvAgencyMids Evening Britt, when I spoke to them earlier our expectation was that it wouldn‚Äôt be needed today. But the team will obviously have been monitoring levels and updating the forecast, especially with this band of heavy rain going through now.
@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids Evening Clare, do you know if you are deploying the plastic membrane in Ironbridge tomorrow morning? Or tonight?
@AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE That was us building the barriers. My colleague was with the army at Bentley. I'm a senior authorised person (electrical engineer) for NPG. https://t.co/UUF4bytFA3

@Calderdale @HalfpennyKerry @floodmary @mrsk3r @slowtheflow_UK @CalderdaleFound @FloodDigitalEA @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency @johncurtinEA @mpsinstltd @MeganClinch @ScottAPatient @BBCNWT @BBCLookNorth @SCcrowther @DefraGovUK https://t.co/1Bo3O4LrlI

tweets.text: We are expecting river levels on the River Ouse in York to peak on Friday morning at around 4.6-4.8m. We continue to monitor the situation. Please stay safe and don‚Äôt walk, drive or cycle through flood water #floodaware https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/ZAEZaCPKhb

@shandy_defender @EnvAgencyYNE I didn‚Äôt know you were involved in that deployment, it looked good. I was in silver at the time.

We‚Äôve got security on 24/7 here to be safe but the scrap value of these is pretty much zero as they‚Äôre just cheap galv metal and I can‚Äôt imagine many people having much use for them.

tweets.text: Have a good evening #suffolkhour, it's a windy night here in #eastsuffolk with a @metoffice warning for gales... roll on summer #Lowestoft #Beccles #Leiston #Halesworth #Bungay #Saxmundham #Aldeburgh #Southwold @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/W9vwQMuJXi

Intense #rainfall indeed. And as well as increasing levels across patch it‚Äôs causing our more rapid response rivers to rise. 

As a result we‚Äôve issued a #FloodWarning for #StokeOnTrent this evening. 

Please follow the advice, stay #floodaware & stay safe. https://t.co/AV9nNP8JtQ https://t.co/s1ZLQDjXmF
Thank you to everyone out tonight helping to keep us all safe @Go_CheshireWest @cheshirepolice @CheshireFire @PoliceChester @EnvAgency and anyone I may have missed.
